name: volume-dilate
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Dilate a volume file.

For all voxels that are designated as bad, if they neighbor a non-bad voxel with data or are within the specified distance of such a voxel, replace the value in the bad voxel with a value calculated from nearby non-bad voxels that have data, otherwise set the value to zero.  No matter how small <distance> is, dilation will always use at least the face neighbor voxels.

By default, voxels that have data with the value 0 are bad, specify -bad-voxel-roi to only count voxels as bad if they are selected by the roi.  If -data-roi is not specified, all voxels are assumed to have data.

To get the behavior of version 1.3.2 or earlier, use '-legacy-cutoff -exponent 2'.

Valid values for <method> are:

NEAREST - use the value from the nearest good voxel
WEIGHTED - use a weighted average based on distance

inputs.name: opt_exponent_exponent
inputs.description: use a different exponent in the weighting function: exponent 'n' to use in (1 / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 7)

inputs.name: opt_bad_voxel_roi_roi_volume
inputs.description: specify an roi of voxels to overwrite, rather than voxels with value zero: volume file, positive values denote voxels to have their values replaced

inputs.name: opt_data_roi_roi_volume
inputs.description: specify an roi of where there is data: volume file, positive values denote voxels that have data

inputs.name: opt_subvolume_subvol
inputs.description: select a single subvolume to dilate: the subvolume number or name

inputs.name: opt_legacy_cutoff
inputs.description: use the v1.3.2 method of excluding voxels further than the dilation distance when calculating the dilated value

inputs.name: grad_extrapolate
inputs.description: additionally use the gradient to extrapolate, intended to be used with WEIGHTED

type.name: grad_extrapolate
type.description: additionally use the gradient to extrapolate, intended to be used with WEIGHTED

inputs.name: presmooth
inputs.description: apply presmoothing before computing gradient vectors, not recommended

type.name: presmooth
type.description: apply presmoothing before computing gradient vectors, not recommended

inputs.name: kernel
inputs.description: the size of gaussian smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

inputs.name: opt_fwhm
inputs.description: kernel size is FWHM, not sigma
